result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
During the pendency of this deferral, the Defendant agrees to:
-Commit no acts which rise to the level of probable cause in violation of the criminal laws of the state of Wisconsin, or of any other state, or of the United States of America.
-Comply with all conditions of bail or bond in this case.
-Pay a fine of $50.00 plus misdemeanor costs and mandatory surcharges as to count 2. 
-Comply with all conditions of probation for count 2. Violation of any rule of probation, or revocation from probation, constitutes a violation of this condition. 
-Defendant will complete the 27 week DAIP program or comparable program upon mutual agreement between the parties if defendant moves/relocates. 
-The parties agree, and the defendant understands, that the conditions of any bail or bond in effect on the plea date shall continue for the entire length of this agreement, and that any violation of the defendant's bond may result in bail jumping charges pursuant to Wis. Stat. 946.49. The defendant further understands that a charged violation of the bail or bond for which probable cause is found shall be a basis for the State to vacate this agreement.
-Defendant will keep Douglas County Clerk of Courts informed of his address and telephone number at all times, and stipulates that the sending of notice by regular mail to the address on file with the Clerk of Courts constitutes sufficient notice of any court hearings scheduled in this matter.  The non-appearance of the defendant may result in the issuance of an arrest warrant.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Ronald Copenhaver

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Christopher Ronald Copenhaver
Current: 13668 170th Ave, Leroy, MI 49655 United States  (Effective: 10-07-2022)
Prior: Lot 6, Belknap Terrace, Superior, WI 54880 United States

2:31 PM Defendant Christopher Ronald Copenhaver in court.  Attorney Stephen Robert Zuber in court for Christopher Ronald Copenhaver.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Parties note agreement. Defendant will plead to both counts. Count 1 will be subject to a deferred agreement for a period of 2 years. Count 2 will be a sentence of 45 days imposed and stayed for a period of 1 year of probation. Conditions of 2 days jail with credit for 2 days (time served), DOC programming, $50 fine plus costs. State notes that the defendant will be required to complete DAIP programming or a similar agreed upon program. State is in compliance with Victim's rights and does not wish to make a statement. 
Defendant pleads no contest to counts 1 and 2. Attorney Zuber stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the defendant's pleas and finds that the pleas have been knowingly and voluntarily made. Defendant is found guilty. Judgment of conviction is deferred pursuant to the agreement in count 1. Judgment of conviction is entered on count 2. 
Attorney Zuber submits corrected plea questionnaire to the court. State makes statements regarding sentencing. Believes that supervision is appropriate. DA to monitor deferred agreement. Attorney Zuber is in agreement with the State. Asks court to adopt agreement. 
Court orders on count 2, a sentence of 45 days jail imposed and stayed for a period of 1 year of probation. Conditions of 2 days jail with credit for 2 days (time served), DOC programming, $50 fine plus costs. 
Defendant's address confirmed.
Deferred Judgment of Conviction

08:50 AM Defendant Christopher Ronald Copenhaver in court with attorney Stephen Robert Zuber.  Chad La Lor appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Attorney states their client wishes to waive their right to the preliminary hearing and there is an agreement to modification of bond. Defendant agrees. Court accepts waiver of the Defendants right to a preliminary hearing as knowingly, understandingly, and voluntarily made. Court finds probable cause and binds the defendant over for arraignment. State indicates that they are in compliant with victim rights. State requests no violent or abusive contact with the victim 1  Arraignment scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.
